other_tests.date: 3 years before the onset of paraparesis
other_tests.changes_over_time: Review revealed signs of vertebral hemangiomas present at levels T6–7 and L-5.

other_tests.findings: Normal results; did not show signs of Lhermitte–Duclos disease.
Lesion involving the vertebral body of L-5 with anterior compression of the cauda equina.
Lesions at multiple levels involving the vertebral bodies of C-6 and T-2; T-3 and T-4 (less extensive involvement); and severe involvement at T-6 and T-7 with spinal cord compression.
Vascularized lesions of the vertebral body at the C-6 and T-2 levels, and at the T5–8 levels.
Abnormal vessels between bone trabeculae, no signs of mitosis, compatible with benign vertebral hemangiomas.
Good decompression of the spinal cord at the T5–7 level.
Stable lesions with compression at the C-6 and L-5 levels almost completely eliminated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Slight regression observed, and no progression of thoracic vertebral hemangioma.
